briefdescription.para: No error.
Max feature count threshold was reached while reading features.
Start point cannot be joined to the graph.
End point cannot be joined to the graph.
Points are not connected in the graph.
Possible errors that may happen when calling findShortestPath()
Destination CRS in which graph is built and tracing done.
Extent for graph building (empty extent means no limit)
Graph data structure for path searching.
A flag indicating that there was an error during graph creation due to noding exception, indicating some input data topology problems.
Input layers for the graph building.
Limit of how many features can be in the graph (0 means no limit).

detaileddescription.para: This is to avoid possibly long graph preparation for complicated layers

briefdescription.para: Offset in map units that should be applied to the traced paths.
Offset parameter: Join style (1 = round, 2 = miter, 3 = bevel)
Offset parameter: Limit for miter join style.
Offset parameter: Number of segments (approximation of circle quarter) when using round join style.
Render context.
Coordinate transform context.
Constructor for QgsTracer.
Returns the CRS used for tracing.
Gets extent to which graph's features will be limited (empty extent means no limit)
Given two points, find the shortest path and return points on the way.

detaileddescription.para:
The optional "error" argument may receive error code (PathError enum) if it is not null
array of points - trace of linestrings of other features (empty array one error)

briefdescription.para: Whether there was an error during graph creation due to noding exception, indicating some input data topology problems.
Build the internal data structures.

detaileddescription.para: This may take some time depending on how big the input layers are. It is not necessary to call this method explicitly - it will be called by findShortestPath() if necessary.

briefdescription.para: Whether the internal data structures have been initialized.
Find out whether the point is snapped to a vertex or edge (i.e. it can be used for tracing start/stop)
Gets layers used for tracing.
Gets maximum possible number of features in graph. If the number is exceeded, graph is not created.
Gets offset in map units that should be applied to the traced paths returned from findShortestPath().

detaileddescription.para:
Positive offset for right side, negative offset for left side.
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Gets extra parameters for offset curve algorithm (used when offset is non-zero)
Sets the crs and transform context used for tracing.
Sets extent to which graph's features will be limited (empty extent means no limit)
Sets layers used for tracing.
Gets maximum possible number of features in graph. If the number is exceeded, graph is not created.
Set offset in map units that should be applied to the traced paths returned from findShortestPath().

detaileddescription.para:
Positive offset for right side, negative offset for left side.
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Set extra parameters for offset curve algorithm (used when offset is non-zero)
Sets the renderContext used for tracing only on visible features.
Allows derived classes to setup the settings just before the tracer is initialized.

detaileddescription.para: This allows the configuration to be set in a lazy way only when it is really necessary. Default implementation does nothing.

briefdescription.para: Destroy the existing graph structure if any (de-initialize)
Utility class that construct a planar graph from the input vector layers and provides shortest path search for tracing of existing features.
